title: Installation issue: installing cuda 10.2.89 and 11.0.2 on power 9 (ppc64le)
body:
Hello, 
          I tried to run spack from a centos 8 singularity container

$ spack install cuda@10.2.89
after a series of nice library installation, finally I arrived to cuda 
```
...
[+] /opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-power9le/gcc-8.3.1/libxml2-2.9.10-fpwdie2higdag72s2a5jy4iap3b6ij75
==> Installing cuda
==> No binary for cuda found: installing from source
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for spack-stage-cuda-11.0.2-ckas64rppoqhk7umivrfjezetbraypah

/opt/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:1149, in do_fetch:
       1146                raise FetchError("Will not fetch %s" %
       1147                                 self.spec.format('{name}{@version}'), ck_msg)
       1148
  >>   1149        self.stage.create()
       1150        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
       1151        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
       1152
```
### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
Singularity> spack debug report 
fatal: No names found, cannot describe anything.
* **Spack:** 0.15.3
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos8-power9le

no particular customization 

### Additional information

I tried to modify /opt/spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml

changing

  Timeout in seconds used for downloading sources etc. This only applies
  to the connection phase and can be increased for slow connections or
  servers. 0 means no timeout.
  
connect_timeout: 10000
